head.title: To Help the Homeless, New York Must Build

hedline.hl1: To Help the Homeless, New York Must Build

abstract.p: Housing Committee, Commission of Religious Leaders chairman Rev Michael S Kendall, in response to Oct 12 news article, praises New York City Rudolph W Giuliani for his decision to provide rent subsidies for homeless families; lauds efforts of advocates for homeless, like Steven Banks of Legal Aid and Mary Brosnahan of Coalition for the Homeless

block.p: It is with relief and hope that we thank Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani for his decision to provide rent subsidies for homeless families (news article, Oct. 12). Housing is a right, and people need homes, not shelters.

It is with relief and hope that we thank Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani for his decision to provide rent subsidies for homeless families (news article, Oct. 12). Housing is a right, and people need homes, not shelters.

The Commission of Religious Leaders of New York City stands committed to affordable housing for everyone and is eager to continue working with the City of New York so that this might happen. We particularly thank the mayor for his willingness to engage in constructive dialogue about those issues that so deeply affect New York's poor.
We also applaud the tireless and caring efforts of advocates for the homeless, like Steven Banks of Legal Aid and Mary Brosnahan of the Coalition for the Homeless.
(Rev.) MICHAEL S. KENDALL New York, Oct. 12, 2000
The writer, an Episcopal archdeacon, is chairman of the Housing Committee, Commission of Religious Leaders, New York City.
